page.title: 15Andoversford - Resident M(3)
page.content: The Gloucester Road, which goes past Mr. Finch's house, was the only road. It went from Gloucester to Stow-on-the Wold. In 1852,a new road was built.It was from Dowdeswell to the reservoir.It came up and joined the road by Sandywell Lane.The first one was on the left hand side of the main road(A40). The construction firm went bankrupt when the railway got to the Royal Oak Inn.The next railway came on the left hand side of Tunnel Hill.It was a single line.It was then increased to double lines.Another line went to Cirencester.Two stations were completed,each with a railway yard which contained coal and goods.
